content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. To prevent deer from running across highways, researchers are investigating sound-emitting devices that would frighten deer before they reach the highway. As part of the investigation, the researchers set up <math alttext="20"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> devices along a two-mile stretch of road. When a deer approached a device, the device would activate and emit a sound. The researchers recorded whether the deer moved toward the highway (positive response), away from the highway (negative response), or did not move (neutral response). The researchers kept the loudness of the sound constant at <math alttext="60"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> decibels. However, they varied the pitch of the sound. There were <math alttext="6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> treatment levels, all measured in kilohertz <math alttext="k H z"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext="0"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0.28"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="1"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="15"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="28"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The order of the treatments was randomly assigned. (a) The control in the experiment was <math alttext="0 kilohertz"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0 kHz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, or no sound. What information is gained by using the control with no sound that could not be obtained if no control were used?

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. To prevent deer from running across highways, researchers are investigating sound-emitting devices that would frighten deer before they reach the highway. As part of the investigation, the researchers set up <math alttext="20"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> devices along a two-mile stretch of road. When a deer approached a device, the device would activate and emit a sound. The researchers recorded whether the deer moved toward the highway (positive response), away from the highway (negative response), or did not move (neutral response). The researchers kept the loudness of the sound constant at <math alttext="60"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> decibels. However, they varied the pitch of the sound. There were <math alttext="6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> treatment levels, all measured in kilohertz <math alttext="k H z"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext="0"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0.28"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="1"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="15"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="28"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The order of the treatments was randomly assigned. (a) The control in the experiment was <math alttext="0 kilohertz"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0 kHz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, or no sound. What information is gained by using the control with no sound that could not be obtained if no control were used?

(b)(i) What is one advantage to keeping the loudness at a constant <math alttext="60"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> decibels for all treatments? (b)(ii) What is one disadvantage to keeping the loudness at a constant <math alttext="60"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> decibels for all treatments?

(c) The results of the experiment are shown in the following bar chart. Based on the results, would you recommend using a sound-emitting device to keep deer from running across highways? Explain your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
